intro: Impatiens undulata, commonly known as the wavy impatiens, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Central and South America. It is characterized by its heart-shaped leaves and clusters of small, showy flowers that range in color from white to pink and violet. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments, such as forest floors or along stream banks. It has a short stem and produces capsule fruits that release seeds when mature. Impatiens undulata is a popular ornamental plant due to its vibrant blooms and adaptability to various garden conditions.
